http://travel.state.gov/content/travel/e.title: Sudan - Level 4: Do Not Travel
http://travel.state.gov/content/travel/e.description:
Reissued with updates to the security situation and post departure status.

Do not travel to Sudan due to armed conflict, civil unrest, crime, terrorism, and kidnapping.

On April 22, 2023, the U.S. Embassy in Khartoum suspended its operations, and the Department of State ordered the departure of U.S. direct hire employees and eligible family members from Embassy Khartoum due to the continued threat of armed conflict in Sudan. The U.S. government cannot provide routine or emergency consular services to U.S. citizens in Sudan, due to the current security situation.

Armed conflict is ongoing throughout Sudan and includes heavy fighting between various political and security groups. The situation is violent, volatile, and extremely unpredictable, particularly in the capital city Khartoum. Electrical and communication disruptions, including internet and cell phone service, can occur at any time.  Khartoum International Airport and Sudan’s border with Chad are currently closed.

Country Summary: Armed conflict, crime, such as kidnapping, armed robbery, home invasion, and carjacking occur.

Members of known terrorist groups and individuals sympathetic to these groups in Sudan could attack with little or no warning, targeting foreign and local government facilities, and areas frequented by Westerners.

Violence continues along the border between Chad and Sudan and areas that border South Sudan (including the disputed Abyei area). Armed opposition groups are active in Central Darfur state and parts of Blue Nile and South Kordofan states. Intercommunal clashes can occur throughout the country and can result in the declaration of localized States of Emergency.

Read the country information page for additional information about travel to Sudan.

If you decide to travel to Sudan:

  • Exercise extreme care in all parts of the country, including Khartoum.
  • Visit our website for Travel to High-Risk Areas.
  • Have a personal emergency action plan that does not rely on U.S. government assistance.
  • Monitor local media for breaking events and be prepared to adjust your plans.
  • Be aware of your surroundings.
  • Stay alert in areas frequented by Westerners.
  • Review your personal security plan and visit our page on travel to high-risk areas.
  • Draft a will and designate appropriate insurance beneficiaries and/or power of attorney.
  • Discuss a plan with loved ones regarding care/custody of children, pets, property, belongings, non-liquid assets (collections, artwork, etc.), funeral wishes, etc.
  • Share important documents, log-in information, and points of contact with loved ones so that they can manage your affairs if you are unable to return as planned to the United States. Find a suggested list of such documents here.
  • Develop a communication plan with family and/or your employer or host organization so that they can monitor your safety and location as you travel through Sudan. This plan should specify who you would contact first, and how they should share the information.
  • Avoid demonstrations and public gatherings. Even events intended to be peaceful can become violent.
  • Enroll in the Smart Traveler Enrollment Program (STEP) to receive Alerts and make it easier to locate you in an emergency.
  • Follow the Department of State on Facebook and Twitter.
  • Review the Country Security Report for Sudan.
  • Prepare a contingency plan for emergency situations.  Review the Traveler’s Checklist.

00dd6abc-14e5-4806-b876-6fbebd84e0fd.creator: USCIS
00dd6abc-14e5-4806-b876-6fbebd84e0fd.title: Update to Filing Location for U Nonimmigrant-Based Form I-485
00dd6abc-14e5-4806-b876-6fbebd84e0fd.description: U nonimmigrants applying to become lawful permanent residents must now file Form I-485, Application to Register Permanent Residence or Adjust Status, only at the Nebraska Service Center and not at the Vermont Service Center.

a05e9ee5-80ac-4619-970f-8ccaf773f657.creator: USCIS
a05e9ee5-80ac-4619-970f-8ccaf773f657.title: USCIS Relocates Lockbox From Phoenix To Tempe, Arizona for Courier Delivery Services
a05e9ee5-80ac-4619-970f-8ccaf773f657.description: On March 31, applicants and petitioners filing at the Phoenix lockbox will see a new filing location for courier delivery services such as UPS, FedEx, and DHL.

b9892b05-501d-42d0-8549-49366f348f40.creator: USCIS
b9892b05-501d-42d0-8549-49366f348f40.title: USCIS Announces Additional Mail Delivery Process for Receiving ADIT Stamp
b9892b05-501d-42d0-8549-49366f348f40.description: Lawful permanent residents may receive temporary evidence of their lawful permanent resident status by mail rather than physically visiting a field office to receive an Alien Documentation, Identification and Telecommunication (ADIT) stamp (also known as an I-551 stamp).

404cac00-8847-4043-baa2-4206b0cfceb2.creator: USCIS
404cac00-8847-4043-baa2-4206b0cfceb2.title: USCIS Removes Biometrics Requirement for Form I-526E Petitioners
404cac00-8847-4043-baa2-4206b0cfceb2.description: Beginning on March 15, 2023, U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services is removing the biometrics submission requirement and $85 fee requirement for petitioners filing Form I-526E, Immigrant Petition by Regional Center Investor.

a795f656-2501-4c4c-817f-38b0105d76eb.creator: USCIS
a795f656-2501-4c4c-817f-38b0105d76eb.title: USCIS Extends Rule Providing Interpreters at Affirmative Asylum Interviews
a795f656-2501-4c4c-817f-38b0105d76eb.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services announced today a fourth extension to a temporary final rule (TFR) requiring use of a USCIS interpreter at certain affirmative asylum interviews.

5efb9dd2-bb3e-4796-baa3-9481e5e1a02b.creator: USCIS
5efb9dd2-bb3e-4796-baa3-9481e5e1a02b.title: USCIS Issues Guidance on Analyzing Employers’ Ability to Pay Wages
5efb9dd2-bb3e-4796-baa3-9481e5e1a02b.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services today issued policy guidance on how we analyze an employer’s ability to pay the proffered wage for immigrant petitions in certain first, second, and third preference employment-based immigrant visa classifications.

3b4b8dd2-d685-4a8b-96e5-d4fe611f2c4f.creator: USCIS
3b4b8dd2-d685-4a8b-96e5-d4fe611f2c4f.title: USCIS Processing Times for Orphan and Hague Adoption Cases
3b4b8dd2-d685-4a8b-96e5-d4fe611f2c4f.description: On Nov. 2, 2022 USCIS announced a change in our method for calculating orphan and Hague adoption case processing times.

392001b6-7082-4b73-a6b2-1219d288197d.creator: USCIS
392001b6-7082-4b73-a6b2-1219d288197d.title: DHS Publishes Federal Register Notice Extending and Redesignating Somalia for Temporary Protected Status
392001b6-7082-4b73-a6b2-1219d288197d.description: The Department of Homeland Security today published a Federal Register notice extending and redesignating Somalia for Temporary Protected Status (TPS) for 18 months, from March 18, 2023, through September 17, 2024.

e9e143d0-80c9-4618-9b1b-0b0da11ab5c5.creator: USCIS
e9e143d0-80c9-4618-9b1b-0b0da11ab5c5.title: USCIS Provides Guidance on Program for International Entrepreneurs
e9e143d0-80c9-4618-9b1b-0b0da11ab5c5.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services has issued comprehensive guidance on parole for international entrepreneurs.

bcbf6bb9-c556-4594-a9d7-609e055180ee.creator: USCIS
bcbf6bb9-c556-4594-a9d7-609e055180ee.title: New Entrepreneur Resources Available on USCIS Website
bcbf6bb9-c556-4594-a9d7-609e055180ee.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services has published additional online resources on uscis.gov to provide an overview of some of the temporary and permanent pathways for noncitizen entrepreneurs to work in the United States.

790396ed-e6b2-434f-8bef-17f8a38e9846.creator: USCIS
790396ed-e6b2-434f-8bef-17f8a38e9846.title: USCIS Updates Policy Guidance on Mobile Biometrics Services
790396ed-e6b2-434f-8bef-17f8a38e9846.description: We are issuing policy guidance in the USCIS Policy Manual to address how we provide mobile biometrics services.

e18beb33-3721-42e0-baa5-207ef85f2453.creator: USCIS
e18beb33-3721-42e0-baa5-207ef85f2453.title: USCIS Announces Premium Processing; New Online-Filing Procedures for Certain F-1 Students Seeking OPT or STEM OPT Extensions
e18beb33-3721-42e0-baa5-207ef85f2453.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services announced today the expansion of premium processing for certain F-1 students seeking Optional Practical Training (OPT) and F-1 students seeking science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) OPT extensions who have a pending Form I-765, Application for Employment Authorization, and wish to request a premium processing upgrade.

017305ab-bbe1-467f-9fbe-45ceca92a955.creator: USCIS
017305ab-bbe1-467f-9fbe-45ceca92a955.title: USCIS Issues Clarifying Guidance on Eligibility for the O-1B Visa Classification
017305ab-bbe1-467f-9fbe-45ceca92a955.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services today issued policy guidance clarifying how it evaluates evidence to determine eligibility for O-1B nonimmigrants of extraordinary ability in the arts and nonimmigrants of extraordinary achievement in the motion picture or television industry.

b799deb5-88cf-4498-9eee-b96119b9918f.creator: USCIS
b799deb5-88cf-4498-9eee-b96119b9918f.title: USCIS Reaches H-2B Cap for Second Half of FY 2023 and Announces Filing Dates for the Second Half of FY 2023 Supplemental Visas
b799deb5-88cf-4498-9eee-b96119b9918f.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) has received enough petitions to meet the H-2B cap for the second half of fiscal year (FY) 2023 and is announcing the filing dates for supplemental H-2B visas for the reminder of FY 2023 made available under the FY 2023 H-2B supplemental visa temporary final rule.

a6971411-466b-4758-88cb-93c3a2157e8d.creator: USCIS
a6971411-466b-4758-88cb-93c3a2157e8d.title: USCIS to Start Collecting Fee for EB-5 Integrity Fund
a6971411-466b-4758-88cb-93c3a2157e8d.description: Today, the Department of Homeland Security posted a Federal Register notice providing information related to the EB-5 Integrity Fund.

https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/hsi-no.creator: ICE Headline News Feed by Category - Operational
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/hsi-no.title: HSI Nogales investigation lands man 51-month prison sentence for assaulting CBP officer
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/hsi-no.description: Cesar Alejandro Avendano-Soto, 21, of Nogales, Sonora, Mexico, pleaded guilty to one count of assault on a federal officer resulting in bodily injury.

c2ef501a-7f19-4dfc-b2af-9a91786387d2.creator: USCIS
c2ef501a-7f19-4dfc-b2af-9a91786387d2.title: USCIS Issues Clarifying Guidance for Individuals Authorized to Work Under Special Student Relief Provisions
c2ef501a-7f19-4dfc-b2af-9a91786387d2.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services is issuing policy guidance in the USCIS Policy Manual to clarify the validity period of employment authorization for F-1 nonimmigrant students experiencing severe economic hardship due to emergent circumstances (also known as special student relief (SSR)) who are work authorized under the SSR provisions of 8 CFR.

https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/west-t.creator: ICE Headline News Feed by Category - Operational, Professional Responsibility
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/west-t.title: West Texas man arrested, charged with bribing HSI special agent
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/west-t.description: Pedro Thiessen, 70, of Seminole, failed to declare more than $10,000 when entering the United States at the Ysleta Port of Entry in October 2022, according to a criminal complaint against him.

5678d5d3-e8ce-4eac-954c-de0e100daf37.creator: USCIS
5678d5d3-e8ce-4eac-954c-de0e100daf37.title: Fact Sheet: REQUEST FOR FEE WAIVER FOR FORM N-400
5678d5d3-e8ce-4eac-954c-de0e100daf37.description: Form I-912, Request for Fee Waiver, for Form N-400, Application for Naturalization

2c9268a9-d1ff-455b-9340-715a80cf8902.creator: USCIS
2c9268a9-d1ff-455b-9340-715a80cf8902.title: USCIS Updates Child Status Protection Act (CSPA) Age Calculation for Certain Adjustment of Status Applicants
2c9268a9-d1ff-455b-9340-715a80cf8902.description: WASHINGTON—U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services has issued guidance in the USCIS Policy Manual to update when an immigrant visa number “becomes available” for the purpose of calculating a noncitizen’s age in certain situations under the Child Status Protection Act (CSPA).

d0c4a31f-f837-4090-a5db-5afdd44b3958.creator: USCIS
d0c4a31f-f837-4090-a5db-5afdd44b3958.title: Reminder to Submit All Required Initial Evidence and Supporting Documentation, including Form I-693, for Form I-485
d0c4a31f-f837-4090-a5db-5afdd44b3958.description: Save time by filing all required initial evidence and supporting documentation listed under the “Checklist of Required Initial Evidence” heading at the same time you file Form I-485, Application to Register Permanent Residence or Adjust Status.

a9252dff-b909-4bf0-ae91-a9e39bbb82fc.creator: USCIS
a9252dff-b909-4bf0-ae91-a9e39bbb82fc.title: Update to Filing Location for Form I-360 and Form I-485 for Self-Petitioning Abused Spouses, Children, and Parents
a9252dff-b909-4bf0-ae91-a9e39bbb82fc.description: Starting February 10, 2023, self-petitioning abused spouses, children, and parents must file Form I-360, Petition for Amerasian, Widow(er), or Special Immigrant, and Form I-485, Application to Register Permanent Residence or Adjust Status, at the Nebraska Service Center instead of the Vermont Service Center.

8900a758-f8e2-47b5-b428-d82145476835.creator: USCIS
8900a758-f8e2-47b5-b428-d82145476835.title: USCIS Clarifies Physical Presence Guidance for Asylees and Refugees Applying for Adjustment of Status
8900a758-f8e2-47b5-b428-d82145476835.description: Effective immediately, U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) has updated guidance in the USCIS Policy Manual to clarify that both asylees and refugees must have been physically present in the United States for one year when we adjudicate their Form I-485, Application to Register Permanent Residence or Adjust Status, rather than at the time they file their adjustment of status application.

71fcc031-c82b-4a0e-9979-d9312e985e04.creator: USCIS
71fcc031-c82b-4a0e-9979-d9312e985e04.title: Cap Reached for Additional Returning Worker H-2B Visas for the First Half of FY 2023
71fcc031-c82b-4a0e-9979-d9312e985e04.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services has received enough petitions to reach the cap for the additional 18,216 H-2B visas made available for returning workers for the first half of fiscal year (FY) 2023 with start dates on or before March 31, 2023, under the recently announced H-2B supplemental cap temporary final rule.

027ea861-e079-48fd-a3e3-6d9846df8e1f.creator: USCIS
027ea861-e079-48fd-a3e3-6d9846df8e1f.title: USCIS Redesigns Green Card and Employment Authorization Document
027ea861-e079-48fd-a3e3-6d9846df8e1f.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) announced today new designs to improve security of Permanent Resident Cards (also known as Green Cards) and Employment Authorization Documents (EADs). USCIS will begin issuing the redesigned cards on Jan. 30, 2023.

5d65b83c-8eb5-4f0c-98ed-ce37a88aa8a3.creator: USCIS
5d65b83c-8eb5-4f0c-98ed-ce37a88aa8a3.title: USCIS Releases New Strategic Plan Highlighting Long-Term Goals
5d65b83c-8eb5-4f0c-98ed-ce37a88aa8a3.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) today released its FY 2023-2026 Strategic Plan, which provides a roadmap for the agency’s workforce to better strengthen its capabilities and help the country reach its highest ideals.

a0e57a2a-b6c8-498a-9f5d-0bde9682ea26.creator: USCIS
a0e57a2a-b6c8-498a-9f5d-0bde9682ea26.title: FY 2024 H-1B Cap Initial Registration Period Opens on March 1
a0e57a2a-b6c8-498a-9f5d-0bde9682ea26.description: Today, U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services announced that the initial registration period for the fiscal year 2024 H-1B cap will open at noon Eastern on March 1 and run through noon Eastern on March 17, 2023.

fde2face-9437-4ab3-a7fb-861141a1026c.creator: USCIS
fde2face-9437-4ab3-a7fb-861141a1026c.title: DHS Announces Registration Process for Temporary Protected Status for Haiti
fde2face-9437-4ab3-a7fb-861141a1026c.description: The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) today posted a Federal Register notice on Temporary Protected Status (TPS) for Haiti.

https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/hsi-pe.creator: ICE Headline News Feed by Category - Management and Administration
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/hsi-pe.title: HSI personnel recognized by Assistant Attorney General for transnational investigation targeting child pornography distributors
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/hsi-pe.description: Assistant Attorney General Kenneth A. Polite, Jr. recognized five special agents and one group supervisor from Homeland Security Investigations (HSI) with the Assistant Attorney General’s Award for Exceptional Service Jan. 19 during the 2022 U.S. Department of Justice Criminal Division Assistant Attorney General Awards in Washington, D.C.

74254089-9bee-48f8-ab69-b03de7112707.creator: USCIS
74254089-9bee-48f8-ab69-b03de7112707.title: USCIS Extends COVID-19-related Flexibilities
74254089-9bee-48f8-ab69-b03de7112707.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services is extending certain COVID-19-related flexibilities through March 23, 2023.

7b72dab6-63d2-49cf-b14e-4c5a24daa779.creator: USCIS
7b72dab6-63d2-49cf-b14e-4c5a24daa779.title: USCIS Extends Green Card Validity for Conditional Permanent Residents with a Pending Form I-751 or Form I-829
7b72dab6-63d2-49cf-b14e-4c5a24daa779.description: USCIS is extending the validity of Permanent Resident Cards (also known as Green Cards) for petitioners who properly file Form I-751, Petition to Remove Conditions on Residence, or Form I-829, Petition by Investor to Remove Conditions on Permanent Resident Status for 48 months beyond the card’s expiration date.

27435d76-4dc8-4fe8-893b-7bf2fd920c1e.creator: USCIS
27435d76-4dc8-4fe8-893b-7bf2fd920c1e.title: Asylum Applicants Can Now File Form I-765 Online
27435d76-4dc8-4fe8-893b-7bf2fd920c1e.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services today announced that certain asylum applicants can now file Form I-765, Application for Employment Authorization, online.

c9f7f202-7d38-4690-a96e-fe98bd057c60.creator: USCIS
c9f7f202-7d38-4690-a96e-fe98bd057c60.title: DHS Announces Process Enhancements for Supporting Labor Enforcement Investigations
c9f7f202-7d38-4690-a96e-fe98bd057c60.description: The U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS) has announced that noncitizen workers who are victims of, or witnesses to, the violation of labor rights, can now access a streamlined and expedite deferred action request process.

d43513ba-4f4f-4116-ae9b-0d688b418bef.creator: USCIS
d43513ba-4f4f-4116-ae9b-0d688b418bef.title: Secretary Mayorkas Extends and Redesignates Somalia for Temporary Protected Status for 18 Months
d43513ba-4f4f-4116-ae9b-0d688b418bef.description: Secretary of Homeland Security Alejandro N. Mayorkas today announced the extension of Temporary Protected Status (TPS) for Somalia for an additional 18 months, from March 18, 2023, through September 17, 2024.

97fd1910-d855-43ae-bc4f-f5cc5e4623df.creator: USCIS
97fd1910-d855-43ae-bc4f-f5cc5e4623df.title: USCIS Announces Final Phase of Premium Processing Expansion for EB-1 and EB-2 Form I-140 Petitions and Future Expansion for F-1 Students Seeking OPT and Certain Student and Exchange Visitors
97fd1910-d855-43ae-bc4f-f5cc5e4623df.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services is implementing the final phase of the premium processing expansion for Form I-140, Immigrant Petition for Alien Workers, under the EB-1 and EB-2 classifications.

502d6756-59fd-498e-b61a-a2986dee4794.creator: USCIS
502d6756-59fd-498e-b61a-a2986dee4794.title: DHS Implements New Processes for Cubans, Haitians, and Nicaraguans and Eliminates Cap for Venezuelans
502d6756-59fd-498e-b61a-a2986dee4794.description: On Jan. 5, 2023, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) announced a safe and lawful way for qualifying Cubans, Haitians, and Nicaraguans with U.S.-based supporters to travel by air to and temporarily reside in the United States.

fff57d10-4552-446e-9548-7e4c70bad2fe.creator: USCIS
fff57d10-4552-446e-9548-7e4c70bad2fe.title: Filing Location Change for Form I-730, Refugee/Asylee Relative Petition
fff57d10-4552-446e-9548-7e4c70bad2fe.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services is changing the filing location for Form I-730, Refugee/Asylee Relative Petition, to streamline workloads in an ever-increasing electronic environment.

b4919893-bf2c-4f86-997c-85764b8833a4.creator: USCIS
b4919893-bf2c-4f86-997c-85764b8833a4.title: USCIS Releases New Immigrant Investor Form
b4919893-bf2c-4f86-997c-85764b8833a4.description: We have published Form I-956K, Registration for Direct and Third-Party Promoters.

471e1f68-9347-48fe-9ed4-6952274c2e3e.creator: USCIS
471e1f68-9347-48fe-9ed4-6952274c2e3e.title: USCIS Issues Proposed Rule to Adjust Certain Immigration and Naturalization Fees
471e1f68-9347-48fe-9ed4-6952274c2e3e.description: Today, U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) published a Notice of Proposed Rulemaking (NPRM) to adjust certain immigration and naturalization benefit request fees.

df5d1d92-6cc1-48e5-804a-b3acc9321abf.creator: USCIS
df5d1d92-6cc1-48e5-804a-b3acc9321abf.title: Secretary Mayorkas Extends and Redesignates Temporary Protected Status for Yemen
df5d1d92-6cc1-48e5-804a-b3acc9321abf.description: The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) today announced an extension of Temporary Protected Status (TPS) for Yemen for 18 months, from March 4, 2023, through Sept. 3, 2024, due to ongoing armed conflict and extraordinary and temporary conditions that prevent Yemeni nationals from safely returning to their country.

https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/ice-re.creator: ICE Headline News Feed by Category - Operational
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/ice-re.title: ICE releases FY 2022 annual report
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/ice-re.description: The FY 2022 annual report highlights how ICE is helping secure the Southwest Border and rebuilding a humane and orderly immigration system; combatting transnational criminal organizations (TCOs) including disrupting the supply of opioids coming to U.S. communities; improving transparency to stakeholders and the public; and supporting its dedicated, resilient workforce.

8ac8a80b-dffe-4357-a41e-c421257e186d.creator: USCIS
8ac8a80b-dffe-4357-a41e-c421257e186d.title: Options for Nonimmigrant Workers Following Termination of Employment
8ac8a80b-dffe-4357-a41e-c421257e186d.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) is providing information for nonimmigrant workers whose employment has terminated, either voluntarily or involuntarily.

5e3bcfab-775d-44d6-b8d5-efb2961c4611.creator: USCIS
5e3bcfab-775d-44d6-b8d5-efb2961c4611.title: DHS’s Public Charge Final Rule Goes into Effect on Dec. 23
5e3bcfab-775d-44d6-b8d5-efb2961c4611.description: On Dec. 23, 2022, the Department of Homeland Security’s (DHS) Public Charge Ground of Inadmissibility final rule will go into effect.

https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/hsi-ba.creator: ICE Headline News Feed by Category - Operational
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/hsi-ba.title: HSI Baltimore-led crime suppression surge nets 45 arrests in 6 weeks
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/hsi-ba.description: HSI’s 45 criminal arrests involved suspects with alleged offenses such as murder, attempted murder, rape, assault, handgun possession, home invasion, burglary, threat of mass violence, theft, drug possession and probation violations.

f33c7542-fb64-471b-9de3-194514ca660b.creator: USCIS
f33c7542-fb64-471b-9de3-194514ca660b.title: Eligible to Naturalize Factsheet: Washington, D.C.
f33c7542-fb64-471b-9de3-194514ca660b.description: USCIS is committed to providing more information on the eligible to naturalize population. This fact sheet provides information on select characteristics of people with Lawful Permanent Residence (LPR) status, also known as Green Card holders in Washington, D.C.

9bb72814-7d42-4e6a-aab2-d32a3517d053.creator: USCIS
9bb72814-7d42-4e6a-aab2-d32a3517d053.title: Eligible to Naturalize Factsheet: New York-Newark-Jersey City, NY-NJ CBSA
9bb72814-7d42-4e6a-aab2-d32a3517d053.description: USCIS is committed to providing more information on the eligible to naturalize population. This fact sheet provides information on select characteristics of people with Lawful Permanent Residence (LPR) status, also known as Green Card holders in New York-Newark-Jersey City, NY-NJ  core-based statistical area (CBSA).

c8666cbd-57f0-4133-a042-ed49a614014f.creator: USCIS
c8666cbd-57f0-4133-a042-ed49a614014f.title: Eligible to Naturalize Factsheet: Vermont
c8666cbd-57f0-4133-a042-ed49a614014f.description: USCIS is committed to providing more information on the eligible to naturalize population. This fact sheet provides information on select characteristics of people with Lawful Permanent Residence (LPR) status, also known as Green Card holders in Vermont.

86a3a8b7-b32d-4ecc-9e0e-0735a4b2fe18.creator: USCIS
86a3a8b7-b32d-4ecc-9e0e-0735a4b2fe18.title: Eligible to Naturalize Factsheet: Miami CBSA
86a3a8b7-b32d-4ecc-9e0e-0735a4b2fe18.description: USCIS is committed to providing more information on the eligible to naturalize population. This fact sheet provides information on select characteristics of people with Lawful Permanent Residence (LPR) status, also known as Green Card holders in  Miami core-based statistical area (CBSA).

b806378e-57e3-4442-baef-0d96a73ed602.creator: USCIS
b806378e-57e3-4442-baef-0d96a73ed602.title: Eligible to Naturalize Factsheet: Hawaii
b806378e-57e3-4442-baef-0d96a73ed602.description: USCIS is committed to providing more information on the eligible to naturalize population.

aeb9394d-8a60-4195-b89a-9ec46a471dbf.creator: USCIS
aeb9394d-8a60-4195-b89a-9ec46a471dbf.title: Eligible to Naturalize Factsheet: Puerto Rico
aeb9394d-8a60-4195-b89a-9ec46a471dbf.description: USCIS is committed to providing more information on the eligible to naturalize population. This fact sheet provides information on select characteristics of people with Lawful Permanent Residence (LPR) status, also known as Green Card holders in Puerto Rico.

5b9345f2-5121-430e-a503-162d398d1a7e.creator: USCIS
5b9345f2-5121-430e-a503-162d398d1a7e.title: Eligible to Naturalize Factsheet: Dodge City, KS
5b9345f2-5121-430e-a503-162d398d1a7e.description: USCIS is committed to providing more information on the eligible to naturalize population. This fact sheet provides information on select characteristics of people with Lawful Permanent Residence (LPR) status, also known as Green Card holders in Dodge City, KS.

d5d22018-3227-4c47-8acd-8d414f44f977.creator: USCIS
d5d22018-3227-4c47-8acd-8d414f44f977.title: Eligible to Naturalize Factsheet: San Diego-Chula Vista-Carlsbad, California
d5d22018-3227-4c47-8acd-8d414f44f977.description: USCIS is committed to providing more information on the eligible to naturalize population. This fact sheet provides information on select characteristics of people with Lawful Permanent Residence (LPR) status, also known as Green Card holders in San Diego-Chula Vista-Carlsbad, California.

7a232b82-16dc-46f0-9f45-7ecde3dcca6c.creator: USCIS
7a232b82-16dc-46f0-9f45-7ecde3dcca6c.title: Eligible to Naturalize Factsheet: Philadelphia CBSA
7a232b82-16dc-46f0-9f45-7ecde3dcca6c.description: USCIS is committed to providing more information on the eligible to naturalize population. This fact sheet provides information on select characteristics of people with Lawful Permanent Residence (LPR) status, also known as Green Card holders in  Philadelphia  core-based statistical area (CBSA).

6ca9bd2e-6262-4b2f-83f9-ade001fd4853.creator: USCIS
6ca9bd2e-6262-4b2f-83f9-ade001fd4853.title: Eligible to Naturalize Factsheet: Kansas City, MO-KS CBSA
6ca9bd2e-6262-4b2f-83f9-ade001fd4853.description: USCIS is committed to providing more information on the eligible to naturalize population. This fact sheet provides information on select characteristics of people with Lawful Permanent Residence (LPR) status, also known as Green Card holders in Kansas City, MO-KS CBSA.

0140bb40-7eb9-4925-88dc-f0892046e262.creator: USCIS
0140bb40-7eb9-4925-88dc-f0892046e262.title: Eligible to Naturalize Factsheet: Alaska
0140bb40-7eb9-4925-88dc-f0892046e262.description: USCIS is committed to providing more information on the eligible to naturalize population. This fact sheet provides information on select characteristics of people with Lawful Permanent Residence (LPR) status, also known as Green Card holders in  Alaska.

c5839217-bf1c-40e7-a7c7-5bfaecb8bf7f.creator: USCIS
c5839217-bf1c-40e7-a7c7-5bfaecb8bf7f.title: Eligible to Naturalize Factsheet: Northwest Arkansas.
c5839217-bf1c-40e7-a7c7-5bfaecb8bf7f.description: USCIS is committed to providing more information on the eligible to naturalize population. This fact sheet provides information on select characteristics of people with Lawful Permanent Residence (LPR) status, also known as Green Card holders in Northwest Arkansas.

302b86c1-97d8-4ae2-8c56-e92dc7d2f9fc.creator: USCIS
302b86c1-97d8-4ae2-8c56-e92dc7d2f9fc.title: USCIS Announces Trial for Updates to the Naturalization Test
302b86c1-97d8-4ae2-8c56-e92dc7d2f9fc.description: The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) today published a notice in the Federal Register announcing that U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) plans to conduct a trial for updates to the current naturalization test.

5106623c-e4ec-4ec5-b37b-6d003dafe3e6.creator: USCIS
5106623c-e4ec-4ec5-b37b-6d003dafe3e6.title: DHS and DOL Announce Availability of Additional H-2B Visas for Fiscal Year 2023
5106623c-e4ec-4ec5-b37b-6d003dafe3e6.description: The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) and the Department of Labor (DOL) are issuing a temporary final rule that makes available 64,716 additional H-2B temporary nonagricultural worker visas for fiscal year (FY) 2023.

de62b68d-83e8-432f-bb83-51ad66539205.creator: USCIS
de62b68d-83e8-432f-bb83-51ad66539205.title: DHS Announces Registration Process for Temporary Protected Status for Ethiopia
de62b68d-83e8-432f-bb83-51ad66539205.description: The Department of Homeland Security today posted a Federal Register notice on Temporary Protected Status (TPS) for Ethiopia.

17d34e0c-d618-4245-9fd0-62e181cdb75a.creator: USCIS
17d34e0c-d618-4245-9fd0-62e181cdb75a.title: USCIS Updates Policy to Automatically Extend Green Cards for Naturalization Applicants
17d34e0c-d618-4245-9fd0-62e181cdb75a.description: Effective Dec. 12, 2022, U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) is updating the USCIS Policy Manual to allow USCIS to automatically extend the validity of Permanent Resident Cards (commonly called Green Cards) for lawful permanent residents who have applied for naturalization.

d1aaa823-3243-4d47-b7e4-cde210734071.creator: USCIS
d1aaa823-3243-4d47-b7e4-cde210734071.title: USCIS Announces Important Filing Information for Upcoming FY 2023 H-2B Supplemental Cap Petitions
d1aaa823-3243-4d47-b7e4-cde210734071.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) is announcing important filing updates for petitioners who will be requesting additional H-2B workers for fiscal year 2023 under the upcoming temporary final rule.

708977ed-6d3f-473f-a5eb-7ebc07c57465.creator: USCIS
708977ed-6d3f-473f-a5eb-7ebc07c57465.title: USCIS Releases New Data on Effective Reduction of Backlogs, Support for Humanitarian Missions, and Fiscal Responsibility
708977ed-6d3f-473f-a5eb-7ebc07c57465.description: Today, USCIS released its Fiscal Year (FY) 2022 progress report with new information demonstrating how it reduced backlogs in certain programs and supported humanitarian missions.

https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/hsi-fe.creator: ICE Headline News Feed by Category - Operational
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/hsi-fe.title: HSI, federal investigation results in criminal charges unsealed against 12 individuals in scheme to monopolize transmigrante industry and extort competitors near US-Mexico border
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/hsi-fe.description: According to the indictment, Carlos Favian Martinez, 36, of Mission; Marco Antonio Medina, 32, Rigoberto Brown, 38, and Miguel Hipolito Caballero Aupart, 70, all of Brownsville; Pedro Antonio Calvillo Hernandez, 47, Tamaulipas, Mexico; Roberto Garcia Villareal, 56, San Benito; Sandra Guerra Medina, 68, Rancho Viejo; and Mireya Miranda, 56, La Feria, conspired to fix prices and allocate the market for transmigrante services in violation of Section 1 of the Sherman Act.

0d82d52e-042d-43a3-88a5-a71417d86a37.creator: USCIS
0d82d52e-042d-43a3-88a5-a71417d86a37.title: Secretary Mayorkas Extends and Redesignates Temporary Protected Status for Haiti for 18 Months
0d82d52e-042d-43a3-88a5-a71417d86a37.description: Secretary of Homeland Security Alejandro N. Mayorkas today announced the extension of Temporary Protected Status (TPS) for Haiti for an additional 18 months, from February 4, 2023, through August 3, 2024, due to extraordinary and temporary conditions in Haiti.

https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/hsi-da.creator: ICE Headline News Feed by Category - Management and Administration
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/hsi-da.title: HSI Dallas, HSI Tampa awarded for financial crimes enforcement
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/hsi-da.description: HSI field offices in Dallas and Tampa were recognized during the 2022 Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN) Director’s Law Enforcement Awards Ceremony, Dec. 1.

https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/statem.creator: ICE Headline News Feed by Category - Operational, Professional Responsibility
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/statem.title: Statement on improper disclosure of noncitizen personally identifiable information
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/statem.description: Upon notification, U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement took swift action to immediately rectify the error.

c0ee2d10-e081-4827-82a7-8a590a323d5b.creator: USCIS
c0ee2d10-e081-4827-82a7-8a590a323d5b.title: USCIS Extends and Expands Fee Exemptions and Expedited Processing for Afghan Nationals
c0ee2d10-e081-4827-82a7-8a590a323d5b.description: Today, U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services announced it is extending and expanding previously announced filing fee exemptions and expedited application processing for certain Afghan nationals.

0c69617e-3d62-49df-80ee-33a6d8c81b0d.creator: USCIS
0c69617e-3d62-49df-80ee-33a6d8c81b0d.title: Certain Afghan and Ukrainian Parolees Are Employment Authorized Incident to Parole
0c69617e-3d62-49df-80ee-33a6d8c81b0d.description: Congress has recently passed laws relating to certain Afghan and Ukrainian parolees that have included language providing that parolees covered by the legislation “…shall be eligible for resettlement assistance, entitlement programs, and other benefits available to refugees admitted under section 207 of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1157)....” Under DHS regulations, refugees are authorized employment incident to status, and under current USCIS policy and practice, refugees are not charged a fee by USCIS for their initial Form I-766, Employment Authorization Document (EAD).

516dab61-5f99-435e-8afb-2d5d804baa58.creator: USCIS
516dab61-5f99-435e-8afb-2d5d804baa58.title: Recommendations for Paper Filings to Avoid Scanning Delays
516dab61-5f99-435e-8afb-2d5d804baa58.description: As we move toward an increasing electronic environment, we now scan and upload many documents into electronic database systems. If you are filing your form with a USCIS service center, To avoid delays and improve scanning efficiency, we recommend that you do not:

2b47c3cc-0370-45ac-ab2e-f2f7177a46a4.creator: USCIS
2b47c3cc-0370-45ac-ab2e-f2f7177a46a4.title: DHS Continues Temporary Protected Status and Related Documentation for Certain Beneficiaries of TPS
2b47c3cc-0370-45ac-ab2e-f2f7177a46a4.description: On Nov. 10, 2022, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) posted a Federal Register Notice announcing the continuation of Temporary Protected Status (TPS) and certain related documents for beneficiaries under the TPS designations that remain subject to the court orders in the Ramos et al. v. Nielsen and Bhattarai et al. v. Nielsen et al. lawsuits.

03a0c3ae-d270-4d0b-a2cc-70fc53aaa119.creator: USCIS
03a0c3ae-d270-4d0b-a2cc-70fc53aaa119.title: USCIS Hosts Special Naturalization Ceremonies in Honor of Veterans Day
03a0c3ae-d270-4d0b-a2cc-70fc53aaa119.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services will host several Veterans Day-themed naturalization ceremonies across the country, welcoming veterans, service members, and military spouses as America’s newest citizens.

e3131bce-dccd-4395-8361-00a270a28379.creator: USCIS
e3131bce-dccd-4395-8361-00a270a28379.title: USCIS Announces Online Filing for Affirmative Asylum Applications
e3131bce-dccd-4395-8361-00a270a28379.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services announced today that Form I-589, Application for Asylum and for Withholding of Removal, is available to file online for certain affirmative asylum applicants. USCIS continues to accept the latest paper version of this form by mail.

b7e2ca0b-4933-42e3-b6b7-34c5c2443cc0.creator: USCIS
b7e2ca0b-4933-42e3-b6b7-34c5c2443cc0.title: DHS Announces Countries Eligible for H-2A and H-2B Visa Programs
b7e2ca0b-4933-42e3-b6b7-34c5c2443cc0.description: The Department of Homeland Security (DHS), in consultation with the Department of State (DOS), has announced the lists of countries whose nationals are eligible to participate in the H-2A and H-2B visa programs in the next year.

https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/ice-re.creator: ICE Headline News Feed by Category - Operational
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/ice-re.title: ICE recognizes FLETA Board’s 20th anniversary
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/ice-re.description: FLETA plays a critical role in supporting the training of federal law enforcement officers, agents, and other personnel.

b12cc216-382c-4ba0-ad82-af292988e084.creator: USCIS
b12cc216-382c-4ba0-ad82-af292988e084.title: DHS Begins Limited Implementation of DACA under Final Rule
b12cc216-382c-4ba0-ad82-af292988e084.description: On Monday, October 31, 2022, the Department of Homeland Security’s final rule to preserve and fortify Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) went into effect.

94181623-bb35-4ac2-b9dd-5e17a957d002.creator: USCIS
94181623-bb35-4ac2-b9dd-5e17a957d002.title: New Processing Time Method for Orphan and Hague Applications and Petitions
94181623-bb35-4ac2-b9dd-5e17a957d002.description: Starting in mid-November, U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) will change how we calculate processing times for orphan and Hague cases.

aec74c2d-8841-48c6-845b-74d0553a9587.creator: USCIS
aec74c2d-8841-48c6-845b-74d0553a9587.title: ACICS Loss of Recognition May Affect Certain Students Applying for English Language Study and 24-month STEM OPT Extension Programs, H-1B, and I-140 Applicants
aec74c2d-8841-48c6-845b-74d0553a9587.description: On Aug. 19, the U.S. Department of Education (ED) announced that it no longer recognizes the Accrediting Council for Independent Colleges and Schools (ACICS) as an accrediting agency.

b527d048-24c0-4204-902c-6514f1869858.creator: USCIS
b527d048-24c0-4204-902c-6514f1869858.title: USCIS Will Only Consider CW-1 Petitions Approved and with Starting Validity on or after June 18, 2020, when Applying the Temporary Departure Requirement
b527d048-24c0-4204-902c-6514f1869858.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services is clarifying its Aug. 25, 2020, policy on implementing the requirement that workers leave the United States for at least 30 days after two renewals of their CNMI-Only Transitional Worker (CW-1) visa classification.

174a3cc5-5521-409f-a92a-8e47d5da1208.creator: USCIS
174a3cc5-5521-409f-a92a-8e47d5da1208.title: USCIS Extends COVID-19-related Flexibilities
174a3cc5-5521-409f-a92a-8e47d5da1208.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services is extending certain COVID-19-related flexibilities through Jan. 24, 2023, to assist applicants, petitioners, and requestors.

https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/hsi-ta.creator: ICE Headline News Feed by Category - Management and Administration
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/hsi-ta.title: HSI Tampa fraud mission awarded by Attorney General
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/hsi-ta.description: The Attorney General’s Award for Fraud Prevention recognizes exceptional dedication and effort to prevent, investigate, and prosecute fraud, white collar crimes, and official corruption. For their skill, professional and dedication, an HSI Tampa benefit fraud mission task force was awarded for their efforts to safeguard the integrity of the nation’s immigration system by disrupting and preventing fraud to obtain unlawful immigration benefits.

6563f19b-2fe6-4e47-bbf5-4a100e69dcdb.creator: USCIS
6563f19b-2fe6-4e47-bbf5-4a100e69dcdb.title: DHS Designates Ethiopia for Temporary Protected Status for 18 Months
6563f19b-2fe6-4e47-bbf5-4a100e69dcdb.description: Today, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) announced the designation of Ethiopia for Temporary Protected Status (TPS) for 18 months.

https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/homela.creator: ICE Headline News Feed by Category - Management and Administration
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/homela.title: Homeland Security Investigations recognized for law enforcement excellence during IACP conference
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/homela.description: Homeland Security Investigations (HSI) was recently recognized for excellence and exceptional collaborative law enforcement operations during the four-day International Association of Chiefs of Police (IACP) Annual Conference held at the Kay Bailey Hutchinson Conference and Exposition Center in Dallas, Oct. 15-18.

3688aa54-ccb1-4225-833f-48054aa6160e.creator: USCIS
3688aa54-ccb1-4225-833f-48054aa6160e.title: Medical Certification for Disability Exceptions, Form N-648, English Language Exemptions, and Accommodations
3688aa54-ccb1-4225-833f-48054aa6160e.description: Medical Certification for Disability Exceptions, Form N-648, English Language Exemptions, and Accommodations

d20fa9a4-e441-42ec-91d9-e8251076e864.creator: USCIS
d20fa9a4-e441-42ec-91d9-e8251076e864.title: USCIS Form and Policy Updates Remove Barriers to Naturalization for Applicants with Disabilities
d20fa9a4-e441-42ec-91d9-e8251076e864.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) today announced updated policy guidance to clarify and conform with the revision of Form N-648, Medical Certification for Disability Exceptions.

30e72f6a-8432-4049-a255-8dc507f4ea71.creator: USCIS
30e72f6a-8432-4049-a255-8dc507f4ea71.title: Filing Guidance for CW-1 Petitions Seeking to Extend Status
30e72f6a-8432-4049-a255-8dc507f4ea71.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services will consider certain CW-1 petitions seeking an extension of status for temporary workers present in the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands (CNMI) to be filed on time, even if USCIS receives them after the worker’s current period of CW-1 petition validity expires.

a153ab12-2cac-4b29-9c6d-5ecc1eca2387.creator: USCIS
a153ab12-2cac-4b29-9c6d-5ecc1eca2387.title: USCIS Implements New Process for Venezuelans
a153ab12-2cac-4b29-9c6d-5ecc1eca2387.description: On Oct. 12, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) announced a new process for Venezuelans.

https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/hsi-la.creator: ICE Headline News Feed by Category - Operational
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/hsi-la.title: HSI launches Operation Boiling Point
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/hsi-la.description: Partnering with federal, state, local law enforcement and prosecutors, as well as financial, retail, freight transportation, and other industries Operation Boiling Point provides a multi-faceted approach to disrupt and dismantle OTGs through partnerships, investigations, and consumer awareness.

e86571c3-83fb-4006-a9c8-04595e48d2d6.creator: USCIS
e86571c3-83fb-4006-a9c8-04595e48d2d6.title: DHS to Supplement H-2B Cap with Nearly 65,000 Additional Visas for Fiscal Year 2023
e86571c3-83fb-4006-a9c8-04595e48d2d6.description: Today the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), in consultation with the Department of Labor (DOL), announced that it will be issuing a regulation that will make available to employers an additional 64,716 H-2B temporary nonagricultural worker visas for fiscal year (FY) 2023, on top of the 66,000 H-2B visas that are normally available each fiscal year.

e77328aa-7b10-4f30-86b1-28ad3ceed080.creator: USCIS
e77328aa-7b10-4f30-86b1-28ad3ceed080.title: USCIS Issues Policy Guidance on the EB-5 Reform and Integrity Act of 2022
e77328aa-7b10-4f30-86b1-28ad3ceed080.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) has issued policy guidance in the USCIS Policy Manual based on the vacatur of the EB-5 Modernization Rule and the EB-5 Reform and Integrity Act of 2022.

6c5a0db2-fd1b-4f43-9173-3faa94c60585.creator: USCIS
6c5a0db2-fd1b-4f43-9173-3faa94c60585.title: USCIS Updates Military Naturalization Guidance for Calixto Class Members
6c5a0db2-fd1b-4f43-9173-3faa94c60585.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services published updated guidance in the USCIS Policy Manual as a result of a settlement agreement in Calixto v. Department of the Army, Civ. A. No. 18-1551 (PLF) (D.D.C.), known as the Calixto Agreement. In the Calixto Agreement, effective Sept. 22, 2022, the U.S. Army agreed to certify Form N-426, Request for Certification of Military or Naval Service, for Calixto class members.

ff1f3e6a-863b-4759-bb68-84188009506c.creator: USCIS
ff1f3e6a-863b-4759-bb68-84188009506c.title: Statement from USCIS Director Ur M. Jaddou on DACA Ruling
ff1f3e6a-863b-4759-bb68-84188009506c.description: “While today’s decision is deeply disappointing, it does not change current USCIS operations. Consistent with the court’s order, USCIS will continue to accept and process DACA renewal requests, and continue to accept but not process initial DACA requests. We remain committed to preserve and fortify DACA within our authority, but ultimately Congress must act to provide permanent protections to DACA recipients and their families.”

e08c5d99-a691-43d8-b800-7753f9bc0e56.creator: USCIS
e08c5d99-a691-43d8-b800-7753f9bc0e56.title: USCIS Awards FY 2022 Citizenship and Integration Grants
e08c5d99-a691-43d8-b800-7753f9bc0e56.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services today awarded nearly $20 million in grants to 66 organizations in 35 states to help prepare lawful permanent residents (LPRs) and those with a clear pathway to lawful permanent residency for naturalization.

d03f7d2f-458e-4740-8df7-9d7ab9d4360e.creator: USCIS
d03f7d2f-458e-4740-8df7-9d7ab9d4360e.title: Extension of Temporary Waiver of 60-Day Rule for Civil Surgeon Signatures on Form I-693
d03f7d2f-458e-4740-8df7-9d7ab9d4360e.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services is extending our temporary waiver of the requirement that civil surgeons must sign Form I-693, Report of Medical Examination and Vaccination Record, no more than 60 days before an individual applies for the underlying immigration benefit (including Form I-485, Application to Register Permanent Residence or Adjust Status).

1d8cfa03-9311-4b9b-b138-10f0a68d576a.creator: USCIS
1d8cfa03-9311-4b9b-b138-10f0a68d576a.title: USCIS Extends Green Card Validity Extension to 24 Months for Green Card Renewals
1d8cfa03-9311-4b9b-b138-10f0a68d576a.description: Effective Sept. 26, U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) is automatically extending the validity of Permanent Resident Cards (also known as Green Cards) to 24 months for lawful permanent residents who file Form I-90, Application to Replace Permanent Resident Card.

2f5c5d57-8bd5-4449-82be-a35b94d29b79.creator: USCIS
2f5c5d57-8bd5-4449-82be-a35b94d29b79.title: USCIS Stops Accepting CW-1 Petitions Under the Disaster Recovery Workforce Act
2f5c5d57-8bd5-4449-82be-a35b94d29b79.description: USCIS will no longer accept CW-1 petitions filed by employers in the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands (the CNMI) under the Disaster Recovery Workforce Act on or after Oct. 1, 2022.

132f9cc9-64e1-4085-bc81-ed02856b9088.creator: USCIS
132f9cc9-64e1-4085-bc81-ed02856b9088.title: Secretary Mayorkas Extends and Redesignates Temporary Protected Status for Burma
132f9cc9-64e1-4085-bc81-ed02856b9088.description: The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) today announced an extension of Temporary Protected Status (TPS) for Burma for an additional 18 months, from Nov. 26, 2022, through May 25, 2024, due to extraordinary and temporary conditions in Burma that prevent individuals from safely returning.

https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/ice-ma.creator: ICE Headline News Feed by Category - Management and Administration
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/ice-ma.title: ICE makes history with first non-US law enforcement partner receiving prestigious award
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/ice-ma.description: Dominguez Martinez, the first law enforcement partner outside the U.S. to receive the award, was recognized for leading Interpol Mexico’s contributions to ERO Mexico City’s Security Alliance for Fugitive Enforcement (SAFE) — a robust information sharing relationship with the Government of Mexico that supports ERO’s ability to identify, arrest, and remove fugitives with active criminal arrest warrants in Mexico from the United States.

9af748d1-1da8-4692-9c8f-3922104ed994.creator: USCIS
9af748d1-1da8-4692-9c8f-3922104ed994.title: USCIS Reviewing Military Naturalization Policy Based on Settlement Agreement in Calixto v. Department of the Army, Civ. A. No 18-1551 (PLF) (D.D.C.)
9af748d1-1da8-4692-9c8f-3922104ed994.description: On Sept. 22, 2022, USCIS was notified of a settlement agreement between the U.S. Army and class members of the civil action captioned Calixto v. Department of the Army, Civ. A. No. 18-1551 (PLF) (D.D.C.).

https://www.cbp.gov/node/379590.creator: U.S. Customs and Border Protection
https://www.cbp.gov/node/379590.title: New Border Patrol Station - Jefferson County - September 2022
https://www.cbp.gov/node/379590.description: CBP plans to prepare a draft Supplemental Environmental Assessment (SEA) that further analyzes the potential effects that may result from the proposed construction and operation of a new Border Patrol Station (BPS) in the U.S. Border Patrol (USBP)…

e71405f2-0cd5-40ab-bce6-650461158403.creator: USCIS
e71405f2-0cd5-40ab-bce6-650461158403.title: Immigration Help Available to Those Affected by Natural Disasters and Other Unforeseen Circumstances
e71405f2-0cd5-40ab-bce6-650461158403.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services reminds the public that we offer immigration services that may help people affected by unforeseen circumstances such as natural disasters in the United States and abroad.

a444b866-f51c-4a59-9b06-e86cb5be6f79.creator: USCIS
a444b866-f51c-4a59-9b06-e86cb5be6f79.title: DHS Publishes Final Rule to Restore Asylum Regulations Consistent with Asylumworks Vacatur
a444b866-f51c-4a59-9b06-e86cb5be6f79.description: The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) today announced publication of a final rule consistent with the vacatur of the U.S. District Court for the District of Columbia in Asylumworks et al. v. Mayorkas et al. This final rule is effective starting Feb. 7, 2022.

ef377539-f64a-4879-8709-25d4c223b4fd.creator: USCIS
ef377539-f64a-4879-8709-25d4c223b4fd.title: USCIS to Welcome 19,000 New Citizens in Celebration of  Constitution Day and Citizenship Day
ef377539-f64a-4879-8709-25d4c223b4fd.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services will celebrate Constitution Day and Citizenship Day this year by welcoming more than 19,000 new citizens in more than 235 naturalization ceremonies across the nation between Sept. 17 and Sept. 23.

c7c5690c-123e-44d1-9bda-9a0e86c2c182.creator: USCIS
c7c5690c-123e-44d1-9bda-9a0e86c2c182.title: USCIS to Implement Next Phase of Premium Processing for Certain Previously Filed EB-1 and EB-2 Form I-140 Petitions
c7c5690c-123e-44d1-9bda-9a0e86c2c182.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services is implementing the next phase of the premium processing expansion for certain petitioners who have a pending Form I-140, Immigrant Petition for Alien Workers, under the EB-1 and EB-2 classifications.

b7af4166-bbc9-4373-bd24-8d2f9638758d.creator: USCIS
b7af4166-bbc9-4373-bd24-8d2f9638758d.title: USCIS Reaches H-2B Cap for First Half of FY 2023
b7af4166-bbc9-4373-bd24-8d2f9638758d.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services has received enough petitions to reach the congressionally mandated cap on H-2B visas for temporary nonagricultural workers for the first half of fiscal year (FY) 2023.

642aa397-51f7-4ca0-9ad8-59c5523077b3.creator: USCIS
642aa397-51f7-4ca0-9ad8-59c5523077b3.title: DHS Publishes Fair and Humane Public Charge Rule (Urdu)
642aa397-51f7-4ca0-9ad8-59c5523077b3.description: امریکی محکمہ برائے ملکی سالمیت (U.S. Department  of Homeland Security (DHS)) نے ایک حتمی اصول جاری کیا ہے، جسے وفاقی رجسٹر میں شائع کیا جائے گا، جو غیر شہریوں کے لیے اس امر کی وضاحت اور تسلسل فراہم کرتا ہے کہ DHS عدم قبولیت کے پبلک عوامیچارج کی بنیاد کا نظام کیسے

4e813d67-545c-41ff-8512-0415e0d3aecd.creator: USCIS
4e813d67-545c-41ff-8512-0415e0d3aecd.title: DHS Publishes Fair and Humane Public Charge Rule (Vietnamese)
4e813d67-545c-41ff-8512-0415e0d3aecd.description: Bộ An ninh Nội địa Hoa Kỳ (DHS) đã ban hành một quy định chung cuộc, sẽ được đăng trong Công báo Liên bang, để thể hiện sự nhất quán và rõ ràng về cách mà DHS áp dụng lý do gánh nặng xã hội để từ chối nhập cư những người không phải là công dân Hoa Kỳ.

04c7c0d3-b23e-4e44-a716-734a246f4cb6.creator: USCIS
04c7c0d3-b23e-4e44-a716-734a246f4cb6.title: DHS Publishes Fair and Humane Public Charge Rule (Ukrainian)
04c7c0d3-b23e-4e44-a716-734a246f4cb6.description: Міністерство внутрішньої безпеки США (DHS) оприлюднило остаточне правило, яке буде опубліковане у Федеральному реєстрі (Federal Register), що забезпечує ясність і послідовність для осіб, які не є громадянами країни, щодо того, як DHS буде застосовувати недопущення до країни на підставі визначення суспільного тягаря.

ca54d968-1154-4443-8ff9-790b3bb3dfe1.creator: USCIS
ca54d968-1154-4443-8ff9-790b3bb3dfe1.title: DHS Publishes Fair and Humane Public Charge Rule (Tagalog)
ca54d968-1154-4443-8ff9-790b3bb3dfe1.description: Ang Department of Homeland Security (DHS o Kagawaran ng Pambansang Seguridad) ng Estados Unidos ay naglabas ng pinal na tuntunin, na ilalathala sa Federal Register (Pederal na Rehistro) na nagbibigay ng paglilinaw para sa mga noncitizens (dayuhan) kung paano ipapatupad ng DHS ang tuntunin ukol sa public charge (dayuhan na umaasa sa pampublikong benepisyo) bilang batayan ng inadmissibility (hindi pagtanggap).

aa05aed8-620d-4425-9d8a-dfd88cabd443.creator: USCIS
aa05aed8-620d-4425-9d8a-dfd88cabd443.title: DHS Publishes Fair and Humane Public Charge Rule (Portuguese)
aa05aed8-620d-4425-9d8a-dfd88cabd443.description: O Departamento de Segurança Interna dos EUA (DHS) emitiu uma regra final, a ser publicada no Registro Federal, que proporciona clareza e consistência aos não-cidadãos sobre a forma como o DHS administrará o fundamento de inadmissibilidade por encargo público.

90bf8d06-a0e5-4379-a494-eb2db3b46191.creator: USCIS
90bf8d06-a0e5-4379-a494-eb2db3b46191.title: DHS Publishes Fair and Humane Public Charge Rule (Pashto)
90bf8d06-a0e5-4379-a494-eb2db3b46191.description: د متحده ايالتونو د کورني امنيت وزارت (DHS) داسې يو نهائی مقرره منظور کړی چې د فډرال په رسمي جريده کې خپرېږي. دغه مقرره د متحده ايالتونو د کورني امنيت وزارت له‌خوا د پرديو وګړيو ( بې تابعته کسان) له‌پاره د دولتی کمکونو د استفاده څرنګوالي موضوع توضيح کوي.

93192cc8-c3b0-4d2e-8a0d-5981cf4cc30b.creator: USCIS
93192cc8-c3b0-4d2e-8a0d-5981cf4cc30b.title: DHS Publishes Fair and Humane Public Charge Rule (Nepali)
93192cc8-c3b0-4d2e-8a0d-5981cf4cc30b.description: अमेरिकी गृहभुमि सुरक्षा विभाग (DHS) ले संघीय रजिस्टरमा प्रकाशित हुने अन्तिम नियम जारी गरेको छ, जसले DHS ले अस्वीकार्यताको सार्वजनिक प्रभार आधारलाई कसरी व्यवस्थापन गर्नेछ भनेर गैर-नागरिकहरूलाई स्पष्टता र स्थिरता उपलब्ध गराउँछ

a397547c-7379-4556-a8dc-8e56dccc0534.creator: USCIS
a397547c-7379-4556-a8dc-8e56dccc0534.title: DHS Publishes Fair and Humane Public Charge Rule (Korean)
a397547c-7379-4556-a8dc-8e56dccc0534.description: 미국 국토안보부 (DHS)는 이민거부사유의 공적부조 심사를 DHS에서 어떻게 집행하는지와 관련해 비시민권자들에게 분명하고 일관성있는 정보를 제공하는 공적부조 규정 최종안을 연방정부 공보에 고시했다.

2dedec51-5c89-40be-9135-c72bfa1adabd.creator: USCIS
2dedec51-5c89-40be-9135-c72bfa1adabd.title: DHS Publishes Fair and Humane Public Charge Rule (Dari)
2dedec51-5c89-40be-9135-c72bfa1adabd.description: وزارت امنیت داخلی ایالات متحده (DHS) یک مقرره نهایی را که قرار است در جریده رسمی فدرال به نشر برسد، منظور نموده است.

43f2ad01-7679-41ff-9256-8f5f2d610388.creator: USCIS
43f2ad01-7679-41ff-9256-8f5f2d610388.title: DHS Publishes Fair and Humane Public Charge Rule (Creole)
43f2ad01-7679-41ff-9256-8f5f2d610388.description: Depatman Sekirite Enteryè Ameriken an (DHS) te pibliye yon desizyon final, ki dwe parèt nan Rejis Federal la, ki pote klète ak konsistans pou moun ki pa sitwayen yo sou fason DHS pral jere motif pou non-kalifikasyon pou chaj piblik.

4d462382-f430-449d-8a7b-2a38aa2311f6.creator: USCIS
4d462382-f430-449d-8a7b-2a38aa2311f6.title: DHS Publishes Fair and Humane Public Charge Rule (Chinese)
4d462382-f430-449d-8a7b-2a38aa2311f6.description: 美国国土安全部（DHS）已经公布了一项将在《联邦公报》上发布的最终规则，该规则为非公民明确且一致地说明了有关DHS将如何管理公共负担原因的禁止入境。

99478aaa-1fd3-4f08-b58d-c7fac4934796.creator: USCIS
99478aaa-1fd3-4f08-b58d-c7fac4934796.title: DHS Publishes Fair and Humane Public Charge Rule (Bengali)
99478aaa-1fd3-4f08-b58d-c7fac4934796.description: মার্কিন যুক্তরাষ্ট্রের ডিপার্টমেন্ট অফ হোমল্যান্ড সিকিউরিটি (DHS) একটি চূড়ান্ত নিয়ম জারি করেছে, যা ফেডারেল রেজিস্টারে প্রকাশিত হবে, এবং যেটি অনাগরিকদের জন্য ধারাবাহিকতা বজায় রেখে খুব স্পষ্ট করে প্রকাশ করেছে যে কোন ক্ষেত্রে DHS পাবলিক চার্জ গ্রাউন্ড গ্রহণ করবে না। কয়েক দশক ধরে বজায় থাকা এই নিয়মটি '

2e104e6c-acfa-4ccb-8999-5cac77e77e13.creator: USCIS
2e104e6c-acfa-4ccb-8999-5cac77e77e13.title: DHS Publishes Fair and Humane Public Charge Rule
2e104e6c-acfa-4ccb-8999-5cac77e77e13.description: The U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS) has issued a final rule, to be published in the Federal Register, that provides clarity and consistency for noncitizens on how DHS will administer the public charge ground of inadmissibility.

5597af49-df98-456c-a834-c949de131408.creator: USCIS
5597af49-df98-456c-a834-c949de131408.title: DHS Announces Re-Registration Process for Current Venezuela Temporary Protected Status Beneficiaries
5597af49-df98-456c-a834-c949de131408.description: The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) posted for public inspection a Federal Register notice describing how beneficiaries under Venezuela’s existing TPS designation can re-register to retain TPS and renew their Employment Authorization Documents (EADs).

560e04b8-5d2e-45b2-881b-d09ca3d2ec88.creator: USCIS
560e04b8-5d2e-45b2-881b-d09ca3d2ec88.title: USCIS Released Revised Editions of Forms I-589 and I-765
560e04b8-5d2e-45b2-881b-d09ca3d2ec88.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services released revised editions of Form I-589, Application for Asylum and for Withholding of Removal, and Form I-765, Application for Employment Authorization, dated 07/26/22.

908245fa-cdf4-41bb-a369-08671ebeda68.creator: USCIS
908245fa-cdf4-41bb-a369-08671ebeda68.title: USCIS Extends and Expands Employment Authorization for Individuals Covered by DED for Liberia
908245fa-cdf4-41bb-a369-08671ebeda68.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) today published a Federal Register notice for the extension and expansion of eligibility for Deferred Enforced Departure (DED) for Liberians and explaining how eligible Liberians may apply for Employment Authorization Documents (EADs).

f2daaba3-2dcf-4631-860f-8bdd66d60909.creator: USCIS
f2daaba3-2dcf-4631-860f-8bdd66d60909.title: USCIS Resumes Cuban Family Reunification Parole Program Operations
f2daaba3-2dcf-4631-860f-8bdd66d60909.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) is resuming operations under the Cuban Family Reunification Parole (CFRP) program, beginning with pending CFRP program applications.

886798fd-529a-4ca8-b7d1-579fc8147d07.creator: USCIS
886798fd-529a-4ca8-b7d1-579fc8147d07.title: USCIS Updates Guidance Related to Religious Workers
886798fd-529a-4ca8-b7d1-579fc8147d07.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) is issuing policy guidance in the USCIS Policy Manual to reorganize and expand on existing guidance related to special immigrant and nonimmigrant religious workers.

932b385f-29a2-4c36-952c-c8bc8059e792.creator: USCIS
932b385f-29a2-4c36-952c-c8bc8059e792.title: DHS Issues Regulation to Preserve and Fortify DACA
932b385f-29a2-4c36-952c-c8bc8059e792.description: Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro N. Mayorkas today announced that the Department has issued a final rule that will preserve and fortify the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) policy for certain eligible noncitizens who arrived in the United States as children, deferring their removal and allowing them an opportunity to access a renewable, two-year work permit.

c092f8e5-398a-4fee-956b-d26400f714e9.creator: USCIS
c092f8e5-398a-4fee-956b-d26400f714e9.title: USCIS Reaches Fiscal Year 2023 H-1B Cap
c092f8e5-398a-4fee-956b-d26400f714e9.description: USCIS has received a sufficient number of petitions needed to reach the congressionally mandated 65,000 H-1B visa regular cap and the 20,000 H-1B visa U.S. advanced degree exemption, known as the master’s cap, for fiscal year (FY) 2023.

e4c7b0ad-7370-449c-9f5b-c5b78f93462d.creator: USCIS
e4c7b0ad-7370-449c-9f5b-c5b78f93462d.title: Updated COVID-19 Vaccination Requirements for Uniting for Ukraine Parolees
e4c7b0ad-7370-449c-9f5b-c5b78f93462d.description: The U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS) has updated the COVID-19 vaccination requirements for beneficiaries paroled into the United States under Uniting for Ukraine.

1e0163bf-6793-4431-bb42-8ca290b7ad0e.creator: USCIS
1e0163bf-6793-4431-bb42-8ca290b7ad0e.title: USCIS Updates Interpretation of “Under Honorable Conditions” for Military Naturalization
1e0163bf-6793-4431-bb42-8ca290b7ad0e.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services is publishing an update to its Policy Manual to clarify that a current or former service member who received an uncharacterized discharge may be eligible for naturalization under sections 328 and 329 of the Immigration and Naturalization Act (INA).

feee536b-b97e-415e-a994-2069121c7614.creator: USCIS
feee536b-b97e-415e-a994-2069121c7614.title: New STEM Resources Available on USCIS Website
feee536b-b97e-415e-a994-2069121c7614.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services has published additional online resources on uscis.gov to provide an overview of some of the temporary and permanent pathways for noncitizens to work in the United States in the fields of science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM). This guide also highlights some of the most important considerations for STEM professionals who want to work in the United States.

cd3c63ac-5eb9-4200-846f-c8f337a0e885.creator: USCIS
cd3c63ac-5eb9-4200-846f-c8f337a0e885.title: Parolees Can Now File Form I-765 Online
cd3c63ac-5eb9-4200-846f-c8f337a0e885.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services today announced that certain parolees can now file Form I-765, Application for Employment Authorization, online.

d55f6d08-196e-4d17-8b57-936f92f56172.creator: USCIS
d55f6d08-196e-4d17-8b57-936f92f56172.title: USCIS Extends COVID-19-related Flexibilities
d55f6d08-196e-4d17-8b57-936f92f56172.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services is extending certain COVID-19-related flexibilities through Oct. 23, 2022, to assist applicants, petitioners, and requestors.

773b8cdb-b9ef-456f-a952-c79fe52e3302.creator: USCIS
773b8cdb-b9ef-456f-a952-c79fe52e3302.title: USCIS Updates Guidance for O-1 Petitions with a Focus on STEM Fields
773b8cdb-b9ef-456f-a952-c79fe52e3302.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services today updated its Policy Manual to provide further guidance on evidence that can be used to support a petition for an O-1A nonimmigrant of extraordinary ability with a focus on science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) fields.

https://www.cbp.gov/node/378230.creator: U.S. Customs and Border Protection
https://www.cbp.gov/node/378230.title: Global Entry for Citizens of Bahrain
https://www.cbp.gov/node/378230.description:
How to Apply for Global Entry:

In order to apply for Global Entry, citizens of Bahrain can apply for Global Entry through CBP's Trusted Traveler Programs (TTP) website.

Application Process:


	Apply Online: Complete a TTP …

bce1ddc5-bb81-4a4c-8146-200000d485df.creator: USCIS
bce1ddc5-bb81-4a4c-8146-200000d485df.title: USCIS Updates Guidance for Afghans and Iraqis Seeking Special Immigrant Classification
bce1ddc5-bb81-4a4c-8146-200000d485df.description: USCIS is updating guidance in the USCIS Policy Manual regarding Afghan and Iraqi nationals seeking special immigrant classification.

b451643b-9c25-4886-9ead-426505ea0bf0.creator: USCIS
b451643b-9c25-4886-9ead-426505ea0bf0.title: USCIS to Implement Second Phase of Premium Processing for Certain Previously Filed EB-1 and EB-2 Form I-140 Petitions
b451643b-9c25-4886-9ead-426505ea0bf0.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) is implementing the second phase of the premium processing expansion for certain petitioners who have a pending Form I-140, Immigrant Petition for Alien Workers, under the EB-1 and EB-2 classifications.

c24ed521-d94d-402a-97ad-e84b3b286d28.creator: USCIS
c24ed521-d94d-402a-97ad-e84b3b286d28.title: Time Frame Extended for Uniting for Ukraine Parolees to Comply with Medical Screening and Attestation After Arrival to the United States
c24ed521-d94d-402a-97ad-e84b3b286d28.description: The U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS) has extended the time beneficiaries paroled into the United States under Uniting for Ukraine have to attest to their compliance with the medical screening for tuberculosis and additional vaccinations, if required. Effective immediately, beneficiaries paroled into the United States under Uniting for Ukraine must complete their medical attestation within 90 days of arrival in the United States. Previously, beneficiaries paroled into the United States under Uniting for Ukraine were required to complete the medical screening and attestation within 14 days of arrival to the United States.

e4a3b59d-53d3-45a4-b27f-2ca784992a5e.creator: USCIS
e4a3b59d-53d3-45a4-b27f-2ca784992a5e.title: USCIS Announces New Citizenship Ambassador Initiative
e4a3b59d-53d3-45a4-b27f-2ca784992a5e.description: Today, U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) announced the launch of the first-ever citizenship ambassador initiative.

e8f0e831-875d-46b0-bf91-c7ff75934146.creator: USCIS
e8f0e831-875d-46b0-bf91-c7ff75934146.title: USCIS Releases New Forms for Immigrant Investor Program
e8f0e831-875d-46b0-bf91-c7ff75934146.description: USCIS is revising Form I-526, Immigrant Petition by Alien Entrepreneur, to accommodate the EB-5 Reform and Integrity Act of 2022, which made significant changes to both the filing and eligibility requirements for investors under the EB-5 program.

8b2248cf-a40d-43bb-9b20-4e99ca962712.creator: USCIS

8b2248cf-a40d-43bb-9b20-4e99ca962712.description: Secretary of Homeland Security Alejandro N. Mayorkas is extending the designation of Venezuela for Temporary Protected Status (TPS) for 18 months.

67ac4d90-be25-4d5e-a529-51088d657662.creator: USCIS
67ac4d90-be25-4d5e-a529-51088d657662.title: USCIS Celebrates Independence Day 2022 and Continues its Commitment to Naturalization
67ac4d90-be25-4d5e-a529-51088d657662.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) will celebrate Independence Day this year by welcoming more than 6,600 new citizens in more than 140 naturalization ceremonies between July 1 and July 8.

fc52ad42-38f7-468c-b966-559f6c8ddfda.title: DHS Announces Expansion of Citizenship and Integration Grant Program and Open Application Period
fc52ad42-38f7-468c-b966-559f6c8ddfda.description: The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) today announced the open application period for the Citizenship and Integration Grant Program, which provides funding for citizenship preparation programs in communities across the country.

05819e21-86d2-4bb9-95f4-fd8382cb418c.title: USCIS Transfers Certain H-1B Petitions to the California Service Center
05819e21-86d2-4bb9-95f4-fd8382cb418c.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services announced today that certain H-1B petitions and fiscal year (FY) 2023 H-1B cap petitions awaiting intake at the Vermont Service Center (VSC) are being transferred to the California Service Center (CSC) for data entry and adjudication.

9fc9a982-6b1c-4c42-913f-533cd7992ba3.creator: USCIS
9fc9a982-6b1c-4c42-913f-533cd7992ba3.title: DHS and DOS Announce Exemptions Allowing Eligible Afghans to Qualify for Protection and Immigration Benefits
9fc9a982-6b1c-4c42-913f-533cd7992ba3.description: Today, the Department of Homeland Security and Department of State took steps to ensure that vulnerable Afghans who have supported and worked with the United States in Afghanistan, and who have undergone rigorous screening and vetting, can qualify for protection and other immigration benefits in the United States.

b589e4be-3597-419b-ba90-6cadfc0a11c8.creator: USCIS
b589e4be-3597-419b-ba90-6cadfc0a11c8.title: Parole Requests in Response to the Shooting in Uvalde, Texas
b589e4be-3597-419b-ba90-6cadfc0a11c8.description: If you are seeking parole into the United States for yourself or someone else to attend a funeral or provide emergency assistance to a family member affected by the shooting at Robb Elementary School in Uvalde, Texas, submit a request for urgent humanitarian or significant public benefit parole by filing Form I-131, Application for Travel Document.

d22be31d-1cd1-4e2a-9735-49e685117128.creator: USCIS
d22be31d-1cd1-4e2a-9735-49e685117128.title: Le DHS annonce le processus d'enregistrement du statut de protection temporaire pour le Cameroun
d22be31d-1cd1-4e2a-9735-49e685117128.description: Le Département de la Sécurité Intérieure a publié dans le Registre Fédéral un avis sur le Statut de Protection Temporaire (TPS) pour le Cameroun.

8abb384f-d37e-4e15-bd66-260a5b50ce58.creator: USCIS
8abb384f-d37e-4e15-bd66-260a5b50ce58.title: DHS Announces Registration Process for Temporary Protected Status for Cameroon
8abb384f-d37e-4e15-bd66-260a5b50ce58.description: The Department of Homeland Security posted for public inspection a Federal Register notice on Temporary Protected Status (TPS) for Cameroon.

2c2e79fe-0fbe-425f-86b4-6d3f7cdc578e.creator: USCIS
2c2e79fe-0fbe-425f-86b4-6d3f7cdc578e.title: USCIS Updates Public Charge Resources Webpage to Provide Information on the Public Charge Ground of Inadmissibility and Public Benefits Available to Noncitizens
2c2e79fe-0fbe-425f-86b4-6d3f7cdc578e.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services has updated our public charge resources webpage with more information to help reduce undue fear and confusion among immigrants and their families, including U.S. citizens and their children, that may prevent them from obtaining access to critical government services available to them.

081da55f-9254-4be8-8fff-6e803d981ed6.creator: USCIS
081da55f-9254-4be8-8fff-6e803d981ed6.title: USCIS Releases New Forms for Immigrant Investor Program
081da55f-9254-4be8-8fff-6e803d981ed6.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services has released two new forms under the EB-5 Reform and Integrity Act of 2022, which revised INA 203(b)(5).

770b716e-167f-4c79-a84c-a55f2e9d1304.creator: USCIS
770b716e-167f-4c79-a84c-a55f2e9d1304.title: Cap Reached for Additional Returning Worker H-2B Visas for Second Half of FY 2022
770b716e-167f-4c79-a84c-a55f2e9d1304.description: Under the recently announced H-2B supplemental cap temporary final rule increasing the cap by up to 35,000 additional H-2B nonimmigrant visas through the end of fiscal year (FY) 2022, USCIS has received enough petitions to reach the cap for the additional 23,500 visas made available for returning workers only.

5ea8f7f0-50d9-455a-89e9-25a47b1affcf.creator: USCIS
5ea8f7f0-50d9-455a-89e9-25a47b1affcf.title: Immigration Help Available to Those Affected by Special Situations, Including the Shooting in Uvalde, Texas
5ea8f7f0-50d9-455a-89e9-25a47b1affcf.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services reminds the public that we offer immigration services that may help people affected by unforeseen circumstances, including the shooting in Uvalde, Texas.

ec14f68e-0f57-4734-8d86-667ac36d5d08.creator: USCIS
ec14f68e-0f57-4734-8d86-667ac36d5d08.title: Statement from Secretary Mayorkas on Efficiently and Fairly Processing Asylum Claims
ec14f68e-0f57-4734-8d86-667ac36d5d08.description: Secretary of Homeland Security Alejandro N. Mayorkas released the following statement regarding the implementation of a rule that will ensure that noncitizens placed in expedited removal who are eligible for asylum are granted relief quickly, while those who are not are promptly removed.

eaf69904-4803-415b-83ce-e73e8241444d.description: Today U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services Director Ur M. Jaddou and agency leadership participated in a virtual public engagement with nearly 2,000 stakeholders nationwide to discuss the agency’s efforts to reduce backlogs and improve processing times.
